item.title: From Europe to India – A little investigated route of migratory birds
item.description: Overcoming multiple setbacks, and teaming up with researchers from across Europe, finally brought insight into the previously mysterious travels of the common rosefinch.

item.title: About me
item.description: I am a postdoctoral researcher at the Alfred Wegener Institute Helmholtz Centre for Polar and Marine Research in Potsdam, and a member of the Geo.

item.title: Animal tracks on the globe with R
item.description: Tutorial (all detailes will follow shortly) I recently submitted a simulation of migrating Bar-tailed godwits (Limosa lapponica) to a vizualisation competition initiated by the BES Movement Ecology SIG.

item.title: Light‐Level Geolocator Analyses: A user's guide
item.description: Established in 1987, the ARGOS system allowed the world-wide tracking of animals equipped with satellite transmitters.

item.title: How our ‘Avian Athlets’ could spread influenza
item.description: The migration of these small birds is fraught with difficulties, and most species will stop along the way to refuel.

item.title: Mitigating conflicts between agriculture and migratory geese: is shooting a viable option or just passing on the problem?
item.description: Following the recent article, Shooting may aggravate rather than alleviate conflicts between migratory geese and agriculture, Silke Bauer explains why management plans for migratory goose populations need to be considered across a broader scale.

item.title: List of publications
item.description: Hoye B. J., Donato C. M., Lisovski S., Deng Y.
